column1: Riboflavin is a type of B vitamin.
Deficiency of riboflavin is not common in the United States because this vitamin is plentiful in the food supply.

Symptoms of a severe deficiency include: - Anemia - Mouth or lip sores - Skin disorders - Sore throat - Swelling of mucus membranes - Growth failure Because riboflavin is a water-soluble vitamin, leftover amounts leave the body through the urine.
